str2: From a derivative of tugchano; fortuitous, i.e. Fortunate; Tychicus, a Christian.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From agapao; beloved.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
And, even, also, namely.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
Probably from an obsolete diako; an attendant, i.e. a waiter; specially, a Christian teacher and pastor.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To make known, declare, know, discover. From a derivative of ginosko; to make known; subjectively, to know.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Perfect Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To know, remember, appreciate.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To do, perform, accomplish; be in any condition, i.e. I fare; I exact, require.
